author: Staff Reporter
text:
Salem-based Annai Arts and Crafts held the mela

Following their last few events, Salem-based organisation Annai Arts and Crafts has organised yet another exhibition of handloom and handicraft products called ‘cotton and crafts mela’ at Neyveli.

This time too, the exhibition has Sheesham wood crafts and carpets from Uttar Pradesh, lac bangles from Rajasthan, pearls from Hyderabad, corals and lucky stones, five-metal jewellery from Karnataka, wooden toys from Andhra Pradesh, jute bags from Kolkata, terracotta items from West Bengal, leather products from Kanpur, agarbattis and perfume from Mysore, Rudraksha beads, glass items from Agra, ceramics, cooking pot (Kalchatti), and other products. There are also paintings, skirts, lace work dress materials, cotton printed sarees from Gujarat, bed sheets, cushion and pillow covers from Rajasthan, quilts from Punjab, bags and purses, accessories and clothes, said the organisers in a press release.

A discount of 20 per cent on handlooms and 10 per cent on handicrafts is being offered to customers. The exhibition is being held from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. at the Sagundha Rama Thirumana Mahal, MRK Salai, Indira Nagar, Neyveli, till January 31.
title: Handloom expo at Neyveli
